abstract: Education debts, changes under the health care law and the economy contribute to anxieties among new physicians.
snippet: Education debts, changes under the health care law and the economy contribute to anxieties among new physicians.
lead_paragraph: Even though young doctors still receive a lot of job offers in one of the worst markets in decades, nearly one-third would select another profession if they had to decide on a career all over again, according to a new study out Thursday.

headline.main: Young Doctors Worry About Career Choices
